resp.text: Thank you John! We appreciate you trusting us with your dental needs!

name: Rachael Jones
text: I had a cleaning here a little while back.  They were very thorough and it was my first time getting a cleaning without metal tools but with this water jet thing.  It was MUCH more pleasant.  The only downside here (which isn’t much of one) is the toothbrushes they give out have a toothbrush head the size of a child’s toothbrush.  It’s really a cute little thing.  Just was surprised to see it. Lol Also, I still don’t understand why because my insurance hasn’t changed, but at my other dentist, cleanings were completely covered by my insurance. But here I had a co-pay.  That being said, they were very kind and did their job well.  My teeth felt amazing afterwards.

name: Mike Gibbs
text: Fortunately, I only had to have my regular cleaning and exam, but you could not ask for a better experience.  The staff is courteous; my hygienist was thorough but friendly; and the dentist did his thing quickly and professionally. Plus, their rates are the most reasonable around this area.  What more could you want?!?

resp.text: Thank you Mike! We appreciate you trusting us with your dental needs!

name: Joey Creamer
text:
We relocated to Alabama several weeks ago and have been on the hunt for a new dental office. My experience as a new patient to the office was beyond 5 STARS! From the first phone call w/ Kaylin, to the warm welcome I received upon entering the office, I was impressed and grateful to have found a new dental home. Christy, my hygienist, bless her heart, she was just a sweetheart, so friendly, and attentive and it was a pleasure to meet Dr. Draiss as well. I am beyond excited to write this review. If you, your family or friends are in need of a dentist, please consider the team at Chelsea Comprehensive Dental.

Carlye Creamer

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words Carlye! It was a pleasure meeting you today. We appreciate you trusting us with your dental needs!

name: Scottie Andrews
text:
From the time I walk I walked through the door you had a good feeling.
First of all let me tell you that I am scared to death of dentist.  But Kelly will put all that to ease.  She will tell you step by step what is going on, what she is fixing to do. She even tells you what Dr. Drace is doing what he is about to. This way you know what to expect how bad it's going to hurt or not. You are not left in the dark about anything. She is a great comforter too. I am 59 years old and it was like I was a child in there. That's not how I was treated that is how I felt . Dr. Drace is awesome.  He is very gentle and you don't feel rushed with him.  I cannot say enough great things about this facility. Giving it a 5 is not good enough.  It needs to be given a big gold medal.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words Mrs. Andrews! We hope you have a Merry Christmas!

name: Susan Lollar
text: I was terrified to go to the dentist. Dr. Bennett and his staff were extremely empathetic. They took time to explain in detail exactly what they were doing and were very patient with me. I was very happy with my experience at Capstone Dental Care. Every single person I encountered was very knowledgeable and helpful. I will definitely feel comfortable next time going back to this office.

name: Kitty Katt
text: This is literally the best dentist I have ever seen.  I am usually very nervous about seeing the dentist and I have had some pretty horrible experiences in the past with the dentist. I also have a few medical issues that make it even worse, so I am so hesitant on going. I had to though due to a cracked tooth and I was looking for a dentist near me. I came across Capstone many times by searching online and asking around. So, I called and scheduled. Boy, am I glad that I picked Capstone! This is the best dentist around and I actually want to go there again! The staff is so awesome, each and every one. And the Dr., she is a miracle worker! The sweetest most understanding and gentle dentist I have ever seen. I had a tooth extracted, and for once in my life, it went so well that I was not scared at all. Not to mention that I was in no pain. She did such a great job and took such good care of me. She even reassured me that if I had any concerns, I could call her anytime. Thank you so much Capstone dental, you are truly a blessing!

name: Linda Wedgeworth
text:
This is an awesome dental practice. Dr Dixon and colleta are really great. Thank you for my dental care.
I would recommend you to anyone in need of dental services.

name: Destanie Knox
text: I HIGHLY recommend Capstone!! The staff is very nice and friendly. Whenever I have questions, they always have the answers and they explain everything to where you know what’s going on. I love that they send the courtesy via msg and email. If you’re needing additional work done , they’re very great with referrals and they even called to have my appointment setup as well. If I could give them 5 stars & 10 thumbs up I would !! Thanks for all you do!!

name: Angie Clark
text: Dr. Bennett is absolutely awesome....My husband and I are so appreciative of his kindness and the kindness of the staff.❤️

name: Izze Herrick
text:
It's a bit hard to find, being tucked up in the back of a strip mall located off the highway, and requires a U-turn to get to if you're coming from the school. The location has baffled more than a few of my uber drivers.

But the service itself is great; the office is very clean and pretty, the staff are polite and prompt, and the service is ideal. They haven't yet tried to upsell me some braces, so that gets them a five star rating in my book.

name: Angelica Joy Waldrop
text: I have been going here for years they are always polite, professional, and always happy to help you with your dental needs. I highly recommend choosing Capstone Dental.

name: Dana Farrar
text: Great dentist and hygienists. They are very safe and clean. My family and I have gotten excellent care from Dr. Dickson and her staff for everything from routine cleanings to mouth guards to very complex reconstruction with porcelain veneers. Always very attentive and great results!

text: This has been a great practice for me and my family for several years. Very friendly staff, great hygenist and I love my dentist. Dr. Dickson is the best!

text: Capstone Dental Care has been wonderful over the last 2 years that I have been seeing them. They are always available for last minute emergency dental work. They are not condescending, which is great for those that are scared of dentists. They offer an in house insurance plan and have waived some costs, which is great for those that don’t have dental insurance.

text: You’ll are the best. Very professional, clean , and etc!!!

text: I had the best experience at Capstone. I was extremely anxious due to a previous horrible dental experience 5 years ago at another dental office. So I basically avoided the dentist for 5 years. I had this horrible toothache for 3 weeks and been to the ER to try and get some relief. My sis in law uses Capstone and took me there this morning. From the moment I walked in I knew this was going to be the day I finally get some help. The entire staff was extremely professional and treated me like family. Dr. Bennett spoke to me and explained everything thoroughly. Everyone went above and beyond to help me. I HIGHLY recommend them. You won’t regret it!!! Thanks again for everything!!!!

She made sure to let me know if I had any issues at all I needed to call her and they would take care of it immediately. I will be going back to them every time I need any dentist work.

text: Waited for 2 hours in the car for my daughter to get a cleaning. Please don't waste your time or money at this place. Go to West Alabama Dental.

text: The second I walk through the door each time, I feel welcomed. My dental hygienist and dentist are always asking about my life and remember me each time I visit. Clean and comfortable environment!

text: Fast and thorough. Can get appointments before hours which is great. Always happy with Capstone Dental Care.

text:
Needed dental care immediately, and wanted an "all service" practice.  This was GREAT!!!  After being treated, ask for my records from my regular dentist to be transferred so I could use Dr. Bennett all of the time.  Everyone was great in the office and I am ecstatic to find somewhere I feel comfortable and don't have to go all over town to get each step of care done.

If you are one of those people who "hate the dentist", I think you would change your mind after being seen here.

Anytime I have an appointment I truly feel as though the Capstone Dental Staff are looking out for the best intrest of my teeth and health.

text: Dr Bennett went far above and beyond for my daughter.  She's an Alabama student and I'm 800 miles from home. He helped us out after she fell and cracked off 3 of her teeth. text: The front staff have always been great & quick to answer any questions I have! My hygienist Vickie always make coming to the dentist a pleasant experience as do both doctors! Keep up the great work!!!!

name: Elise Goubet
text:
Everything and everyone at Capstone Dental Care is phenomenal. Their service is fast and efficient and I have never had to wait more than 10 minutes to get called back. I am usually in and out in less than an hour, even the last time when I had to have a filling. For my 6-month check-ups they give reminder calls early enough in advance to re-schedule if I need to. The back office and front office staff are incredibly helpful and nice. When I locked my keys in my car and went back in to see if I could wait in their office until someone could bring my spare keys, the front office staff was so helpful. They asked if I needed to use their phone to call someone and offered me water and coffee, amazing service!
I just don't have enough great things to say about this office!

text: Friendly great staff and Dentists. Treat you like family.

name: Zachary Terry
text: The staff was very professional and the building was well kept and clean over all a good experience.

text: I apologize for my previous review and proud to see Capstone Dental take a positive stand against inappropriate behavior. Thank You.

name: Robin Graham
text: Dr Barrett is amazing! At 8 at night he drove back to his office to fix an emergency tooth breakage I had. He is so nice!

text: Never really liked the dentist... However, They made sure I was comfortable and cared for. Huge shoutout to Tara she performed my cleaning and she has the hands of an angel!

text: I have been a patient for several years now and definitely plan to continue. They have a great atmosphere from folks like Mandy Thomas up front to those taking great care of my teeth. Thank you fir all that you do!!!

name: Kailey Check
text: I really needed to dump my old dentist and was intrigued by the reviews for this one - after my visit today I can say they are 100% accurate. Everything was fast and efficient, the building and staff are plentiful to accommodate multiple patients at one time, so do not fret if you feel like you are in a sea of people in the waiting room. Dr. Bennett was thorough and informative - he showed me what he was talking about with a mirror as well as the x-ray, and took his time explaining areas of concern and why or how they occur. My dental hygienist (Stephanie!) was also fantastic. I did not feel rushed, shamed, or confused during this visit. I will definitely be back.

name: Barbara Moroz
text: Everyone is great! Dr. Bennett and Vickie always take care of me.

name: Julia Beedle
text: Extremely friendly front staff! The hygienist, Noelle, is extremely knowledgeable and does an excellent job!

name: kristi mullis
text: Changed dentist due to insurance and needed a filling, so I was told when I went for my appt. scheduled a time to come back for filing, only to come back a few days later with terrible tooth pain. Another X-ray and was told I needed a root canal. All that pain for the filing useless now having to go back in and get a root canal. Been back several times after my root canal and I'm still in pain. I'm not dentist but a root canal means there is no root, therefore I shouldn't still be in pain after almost 3 months later. Changing dentist and hope to get some answers. I didn't even get a chance to have my families appts because the trouble I've had, I don't want them to experience it.

name: JT Odom
text: Thank you to Dr John Bennett and his team. I can finally smile again.

name: Jeneisha Adams
text: Best service ever! Everyone was very nice, attentive, and helpful the entire visit. I totally recommend this practice.

name: Megan Gunter
text: Kind staff, very dedicated to making sure you are well taken care of.  Clean and  comfortable environment  throughout the office.

name: Missy Jones
text: Mandy Thomas was the most helpful person when I had to interact with my insurance company. She handled everything with a smile!

name: Gary S
text: Great staff, always very friendly and professional!

name: Michael Burdick
text: Best dental care ever!

name: Cheryl Goree
text:
Long story, short...Had a few issues with them. #1 Lack of honesty
#2 Lack of knowledge
#3 Lack of care and concern
Whispering and gestures among a few of the associates, when they were confronted about dental work. A crown job that took three hours over the estimated time, and as it turned out, had to have the crown taken off and replaced by another dentist, so I went through five hours of hell, for nothing more than two more hours of hell.  Being charged more at check out, than what I was told it would cost. Filed a grievance with my insurance provider, and after their investigation, Capstone was advised to reimburse me. I haven't even gotten a response from them, and it has been seven months.

name: Lynn McColl
text: Love this dental office!  Especially Mandy and her help with my insurance, she made the difference!

name: Damon Holland
text:
My son, a freshman, 7 hours away from, chipped his front two teeth. He asked the dentist to just repair/bond them to hold him until he can get home. His aunt is his dentist and could take care of the rest. The dentist was insistent on wanting him to have over a thousand dollars worth of treatment. I spoke with(& showed x-rays)to other dentists & endodontist.  After seeing them they all agreed he did not need a double root canal, crown etc... he was not in any pain. He spoke down to my son for what he had requested to be preformed. The tooth chipped off 6 hours after he bonded the tooth.  My son had to go back two days later to have it repaired. The dentist was cocky and when finishing with the repair he didn't even shake my sons hand or have anything good to say when leaving the room.
I think he was mad that we stood our ground and didn't let him run a new college student over the coals with his thousands of dollars worth of charges. I am a physician. I couldn't imagine taking advantage of a young college student and their families that are many hours away and not every family can come up with over a thousand dollars in an instant for something that can wait. Thankfully we had other professionals to guide us.

name: arkeisha thomas
text: The staff is always awesome!

text: LOVE Capstone Dental Care! Esp Mandy Thomas!!

name: Shantel Ervin
text: As a cancer warrior, I have had my share of doctors appointments, treatments, surgical procedures and more. Because of this my pain threshold is high so if I say something hurts it really hurts. My previous dental office was aware of this yet the hygienist chose to ignore the pain I was experiencing. After speaking with the office manager I decided I would not complete my appointment and later called back and canceled any further treatment with that practice. I called my insurance company and located the office of a previous dentist that I loved and I am so glad I did. I called Bryant Dental on Bob Wallace and even the interaction over the phone was pleasant. Whitney was able to schedule me an appointment quickly and educated me on the processes and procedures and what to expect. I could hear her smile through the phone. The day of my appointment, the entire staff was absolutely wonderful! As a new patient for the practice I knew I would have paperwork and would probably be there for a while but as soon as I finished my paperwork my hygienist was waiting for me. Chelsey greeted me with smiling eyes (she had on her mask), explained the process in depth and after reviewing my x-rays she recommended the best next step to help with my issues. She listened and made sure to understand what I was experiencing and throughout my appointment she made sure the process was not causing too much pain. With tender swollen gums pain is to be expected however if the hygienist knows what they are doing the patient will experience minimal pain. Chelsey knows what she is doing! She took a potentially mouth throbbing, tears running uncomfortable situation and made it a pleasant and educational experience. I went in with my mouth feeling awful and because of what Chelsey did my teeth feel so much better. Because I am a cancer warrior my teeth and gums have gone through some major changes. Chemo, radiation and long term medication has caused damage that I thought was going to take radical treatment to repair but Chelsey explained how to minimize further damage and what to do to get me on a path of recovery. She was absolutely amazing! I highly recommend Bryant Dental on Bob Wallace, you will not be disappointed.

resp.text: Wow to that wonderful review!  We are so happy to hear about your great experience with us!  We will pass these sweet words you shared on to the staff and especially let Chelsey and Whitney know :)

name: Anfernee Ragin
text: Had my first checkup here today with Chelsey and really appreciated her advice and insight on how to adjust/improve my dental hygiene approach! Strongly recommend Bryant Dental for anyone new to Huntsville looking for a dentist.

resp.text: Thank you for the great review Anfernee!  Chelsey is great!  We will let her know about the positive feedback :)

name: Colleen Sauls
text: Let me save some of you the trouble. They use Transworld System collection agency when Tonya makes a mistake with your treatment plan and tells you your insurance will pay half and you pay the other half ($560) and then it turns out TONYA read it wrong but expects the patient to pay for her mistake you will get turned over to a collection agency! I liked Dr. Bentley and was very disappointed she let her office manager get away with dirty office practices, so I had no other choice but to find another dentist for my son and I. Tonya wouldn’t let me speak to Dr. Bentley she twisted what happened to fit her narrative and let Dr.Bentley think they were doing me a favor by cutting the bill in half when all along Tonya knows this is on her! And she sent a $240 bill to collections on a procedure that wasn’t even done correctly (we were told my son didn’t need a crown turns out he did but because of Tonyas error reading our policy which is her job by the way we never went back to Dr.Bentley after getting a $500 bill in the mail no phone call Tonya knew I would be upset and she knew exactly what she told me) and the tooth had to be extracted after all of that! So NO  I do not recommend you go there! Not because of Dr. Bentley but because you cannot trust Tonya to do your insurance and billing correctly! Do you have an extra $1000.00  laying around when you get a surprise bill from Tonya? When I asked Tonya why she didn’t catch that the insurance wouldn’t cover that procedure she said to me well neither did you! Wow!! Tonya claimed to have gotten an approval for the procedure when all along root canals weren’t covered within the first year of coverage (so that was a lie to cover her mistake) I would have thought an office manager and the person who is supposed to verify insurance would check that first thing! I have never had this happen before over 30 years of taking myself and 2 kids to the dentist! So there you have it! Chelsea & Jennifer are great though!

resp.text: So sorry Colleen that there was any issue with your time with us at Bryant dental.  Unfortunately with insurance they always have the disclaimer that it is an estimate and not a guarantee of payment.  As a courtesy we strive to help our patients by handling all the dental billing rather than collecting all payments up front for procedures creating the hassle for the patient to handle all billing to his or her own insurance.  It's a partnership where we rely on what the insurance provides us and what the insurance provides to the patient about their own coverage.  We definitely do our best on our end to try to gather all the information about waiting periods, missing tooth clauses and percentages covered.  We will look into your account and see what happened in your situation.  Once again we apologize you had anything but the best experience with us!

name: Jeffrey Smith
text: Just returned from having a root canal at the Huntsville office..Terrible experience...assistant didn't introduce herself so I couldn't tell you her name or the dentist because he didn't either (when we were leaving my wife found out it was Dr. Willis)..no tell me what's going on or anything..I passed on info from previous dentist as was told to do but was quickly dismissed with we don't do that..just you need to see a specialist...how about what type of specialist? I informed them that cold water really hurts my teeth and dentist said, "Really nothing I can do about it unless I numb your mouth."  In addition, I told both that it does not feel numb where you put the shots..most dentists would probably give you another shot to help..not this one (wasn't even offered anesthesia)...of course they sprayed cold water in my mouth and I jumped you may need to know...dentist says I can't do anything if you jump to which I replied "That is why I told you prior to starting about what you may need to know!" Sprayed cold water in mouth and it sprayed all over my face no goggles and never wiped off my face.  Dentist went back and forth with me on why I was telling him anything about cold water or numbness..after getting through it there was no what to do if I experience pain afterwards, wife had to go back in and ask.  I found the dentist and assistant very rude and unprofessional.

resp.text: So sorry to hear you didn't have a great experience with us Jeffrey!  This definitely doesn't sound like the experience we want for any of our patients or that we typically have as our normal feedback.  I will reach out to the office manager and she will contact you.  We always want to create a wonderful experience for all our patients and will look into this complaint.

resp.text: We are very sorry to hear this Emily. We will have management personally reach out to you and try to get issues resolved our end.  We apologize for the inconvenience you experienced and will work to make sure it never happens again.

text: Just had my first dental visit since leaving the military. I have not been to a dentist since joining the military, 8 years ago, since they do regular checks. Megan my Dental Hygienist was great and very thorough when cleaning my teeth. She checked on me regularly to make sure I was ok and that I was not experiencing any discomfort during the cleaning. She gave me great tips and ways to make sure my teeth were getting properly cleaned between visits. Dr. Kristen R. Bentley was also very thorough and very informative when checking my teeth. I would highly recommend using this dentist.

name: Susan W
text: I called this office because I just moved here, and I had many questions about insurance and about the doctor and I had the pleasure of talking to the nicest young man on the phone. I believe his name was Preston. I’ve never in my 46 years spoken to someone on the phone and felt like we knew each other. He was so polite and made me feel more at ease with coming to the dentist. I’ve always been scared of the dentist. He helped me so much and answered my questions. I never make reviews but I told my daughter how nice he was and she’s going to make an appointment too. I can’t wait to come in and meet everyone. I have always had bad experiences with people on the phone because I have been told I like to talk and ask a lot of questions but he never got frustrated with me. People like him are what brings joy to people like me. :-)

resp.text: Thank you so much for the kind words. We will be sure to let Preston know!

name: Alana Moore
text: It was my first time at Bryant Dental.  Dr. Bentley and her entire staff were awesome.  My hygienist, Megan, was very friendly, professional and and did a great job.  I would recommend her to anyone+!

name: Frank Wagner
text: Found Bryant Dental on Cigna’s in network provider list. Called them to make sure they were a Cigna in network provider and they said they were. Stopped in the office and asked again if they were in network for Cigna and after they said they were, I made cleaning and exam appointments for my wife and I. During the appointment day, I presented my Cigna card. Cleaning and Exam were done appropriately. Now Bryant Dental is trying to bill me, because they are not in network for my Cigna plan. Cigna did pay them for the services, but Bryant wants even more than what a cleaning and exam are. Under Cigna in network plan the cleanings and exam are 100 percent covered. I’ve talked to them about this to no avail.

resp.text: I hate to hear that you had any issue Frank.  A management team member look into your account and reach out to you.

name: Alan King
text: Just had the second phase of deep cleaning. I was very impressed with how thorough my hygenist Megan was and also very impressed with Dr Kristen Bentley. I highly recommend them.

name: Ruthinya Bishop
text: Terrible experience I had a splint ordered since last December and got the first one it was wrong. The second time another was ordered and it was wrong. I had already paid for the splint $335. The doctor stated he needed to order another one at this point its terrible because my mouth and face were in pain. The assistant waited to call the company in turn she was rude and I had to wait to find out when my splint that had been paid for was going to arrive. I explained that it was not right I had to keep waiting on the right splint. The assistant said it was not their fault the company got it wrong but I disagree!!  I asked if I could be reimbursed for the splint the assistant manager stated she couldn't reimburse me. I have been going to Bryant dental for over a year and never had any problems until this splint. I had impressions done on this splint in December before the holidays its going on February and they never got it right! Very unprofessional and doesn't value good patients with longevity. Staff is not professional at all!!!

name: Kendra Poe
text: I absolutely love this dentist.The staff are very attentive and sensitive to my needs and AlWAYS make me feel comfortable ❤️ Also the secretary Preston has such a warm caring demeanor.They are all awesome people❤️Highly recommended !!

They explained everything that might have been caused the problems I was having and gave me professional tips on how to prevent them and treat them. I would recammend to anyone in search of a dentist!

text: I had the worst experience with this place. They had me come back over and over never once mentioning my balance. When they figured out how much they would be getting from insurance.They stopped being nice and demanded payment. I made a payment to them but that was not enough. It had to be exactly what they wanted or they could not do the work to finish my procedure. I walked away with half of my mouth done. Then they wouldn't give me my xrays so I could get it done someplace else because I had a balance. So much for customer service. Also they called to remind me of an appointment for my daughter like I would bring my daughter there after that.

name: Trae L .
text: What a disturbed person. I went in for a filling for 180 dollars&l walked out without my money or my filling. Angela seems to think her office power spills over into legal power.. She said shes been out of the country so my refund will be at her discretion. l threatend with a lawyer & she laughed at me.Why is returning my money for services unrendered up to Angela? What a shady way to steal from unsuspecting people.. Why is this allowed? Should she be allowed to play around with patients money? She sure is a cold hearted women. Stealing is wrong anyway you look at it but,stealing from a disabled man on a fixed income is sick in the head...This is about the Decatur office.

name: Keely Barker
text: Everyone is so friendly. No judgement.

text: I was very satisfied with my visit and shall be back.

name: Southern Dakota
text: Great customer service, they have massage dental chairs and TV to watch while you're getting your teeth cleaned etc... Quality of work is excellent and focused on your needs and requests.

text: Megan was excellent! She didn’t beat up my gums the way some hygienists will & Dr Bentley is always great!

name: Jetty Guliani
text: Terrible!!! Went there for a free teeth cleaning that was covered by my insurance. They dental assistant photographed my teeth and measured them.  They told me that they would need to do a 3 phase cleaning which will cost me over $700 with my insurance, I told them NO, I came here for a free cleaning.  I left and they sent me a bill for almost $200 for my supposedly FREE teeth cleaning.  They are some crooks, I wouldn't recommend them to anyone but my worse enemy.

name: Toni Worrell
text: I agree with jade... i am a severe Dentaphobe and called to change dentists after a bad experience with my other dentist.  My first visit was ok, but something seemed off.  I assumed it was my fear, and continued goung. I was told I would need a crown.  I show up terrified and they start working on me with nitrox. He says I don't  need it and after several minites, gives me the nitrox, but does not give it time to work. He then drills pokes and grinds, while I am crying. . They fit the temp crown and say I can pay when they put new crown on. I am then in  PAIN for 3 weeks. I go back in he says he wants to put me on steroids and pain meds, but he may have to do a root canal.  They will check to see how I am and setup another appointment.  NEVER HAPPENED.  got a bill in the mail for my crown that I never got... when I called them, their number listed on bill was disconnected. Can you say, "" you know a good attorney? "

name: McKenzey Harvey
text: Everyone is great!

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words!  We will pass on to the staff :)

name: Dashawn Kim
text: Great visit as always!!

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Ragnarok The Destroyer
text: How bout a review from someone that wasnt paid or someone you know?

name: Pat Benefield
text: Professional performance

name: Bj Bonner
text: Dr. Lane is unquestionably the best medical professional I have ever encountered!.  When I say ever, I mean it!  He is thoughtful, friendly, caring, engaging and of course extremely knowledgeable.  Having any type dentistry performed sends my anxieties through the roof.   My experience with he and his staff was just the opposite.  I left in a better mood than I came in with.  I highly recommend him!

name: Tamara Samuel
text: Dr. Lane and his staff were awesome! I was greeted so well on the phone, and in person, by the young ladies at the desk. This set the tone for the rest of the visit. Dr. Lane was just as friendly, informative, and understanding. He gave excellent advice concerning my upcoming procedure, and was very straightforward about it all. I'm very excited about being his patient-he's already established a sense of trust with me. Thank you, Dr. Lane!

name: casey smith
text: I am a recent patient of Dr. Lanes. I came to see him because I was having gum issues after a tooth extraction. He was completely professional and kind. He explained to me where my gums were in regards to their health and things I could do to help heal my canker sores that I had had for weeks. Additionally, went above and beyond to explain some of the technical aspects of gum problems. He definitely showed his knowledge in the area. I will definitely be going back to Dr. Lane for all gum issues.

name: Richard Klimas
text:
Excellent experience !!!!
Friendly and very professional staff.
Everything proceeded efficiently and on time.
Dr Lane was great. Best exam ever.
All treatment options clearly presented and thoroughly explained.
Could not have been better.
Would recommend without hesitation !!!!!

name: Abigail Hanvey
text: Love this place! I had to have a gum graft and Dr. Lane was amazing! He told me that I would only need a couple days of pain pills and I just kept thinking there’s no way because they took a graft from the back of my mouth and put in on my front teeth but he was right! Him and his whole staff made the whole process easy. His staff is extremely nice and welcoming! I recommend him to anyone that needs dental work done!

name: Louise Meyers
text:
Everything, literally, about my experience from start to finish has been excellent! Dr. Lane is a true exceptional professional; always on time with appointments, excellent communication and taking initiative on follow up. His office staff is expedient, kind, and always treated me like I was their only patient even though it is a very busy office.

Dr. Lane did gum grafts for me as well as the removal of tooth and bone, bone graftings, insertion of post and ct scans to make sure each step of the way was working well. In this ten-month process, I have never had even one disappointment. He called me at home to check on me after the bone grafts, gum grafts, and post insertion. His collaboration with my dentist, who will finish the crown work, is seamless.

He is always kind, not just to me, but he frequently thanks his staff for their assistance. I highly recommend Dr. Lane for any periodontal work and I was so glad I was referred to him.

name: Big Lee
text: Exceptional service!!! I had to have a couple tooth extractions plus laser for advanced periodontal disease & Dr. Lane was with me every step of the way during recovery. This guy gives you his personal cell & checks on you!!! Staff is super-friendly!!! I highly recommend Dr. Lane & his staff✔✔✔

name: B. Principled
text: Always have an excellent experience with Dr. Lane and his staff. The hygienist is a hoot, and I truly enjoy visiting with her.  All are knowledgeable, personable, professional people. Couldn’t ask for more.

name: Randy D. Colvin
text: Most personable, polite, and profession experience of any specialty service I’ve ever seen. Super informative, given in a straight-forward manner that is easy to understand pre-op/post-op instructions.

name: Sunni Hulsey
text: Dr. Lane was wonderful. He explained everything to me so well and was so kind. I’d recommend him to anyone. I think he is an exceptional periodontist and this is coming from a hygienist. He’ll be the first person I recommend to my patients in private practice.

name: Nora Hand
text: First time to go to Dr. Lane. I took my handicapped brother. Dr. Lane was so patient and kind! Very honest   and helpful for our situation. I would highly recommend him to anyone.

name: Michelle West
text: Dr Lane and his hygenists have been very compassionate and gentle.  I think they truly car about their patients.  I'm very appreciative.

resp.text: Thank you so much!

name: Patricia Kirkland
text: Excellent periodontal service.  Dr. John M. Lane, DMD, has helped we correct my gum issues and provided me with awesome implants.  I am so grateful to be one of his patients.  The office staff is very knowledgeable and cordial.  Outstanding dental hygienists provide superb dental assistance.

name: Jaquelyn Summers
text:
Dr Lane and his staff are wonderful.  From the front desk to the hygienists, everyone is friendly, professional and eager to assist in making my visit the best it could be.  Dr Lane is compassionate, gentle and upfront about treatment options.  He always makes me feel comfortable and I am confident that he will provide the best care without doing anything unnecessary.
I highly recommend his practice to anyone.

name: Erica Banks
text: I want to thank everyone that took part in  my dental surgery today at Dr. Lane’s office. From my very first visit until now has been a great experience. They take all precautions needed to follow the COVID-19 state guidelines and for everything they’ve done I’m grateful and would highly recommend this office. Thank you again Dr. Lane and your beautiful staff.

name: Eric Boykin
text: Professional, communicative, and gentle. My first visit for a cleaning/consultation was such a pleasant experience that I left questioning my previous visits with other periodontists. Dr. Lane and staff have certainly set a high bar.

name: Larry Monaco
text: Dr Lane is the most thoughtful and considerate professional I have ever met. His staff is the same. A special thanks to Kim who did my x-rays. Really enjoyed working with her.

name: Jill Wallace
text: Dr. Lane and his staff were excellent to work with.  Every person was very pleasant and accommodating. They made sure that I was well taken of, and called me at home to check on me after my procedure.  I highly recommend them to anyone who needs periodontal treatment.

name: Bobby DeNeefe
text: Outstanding service. Great staff.

resp.text: Thank you so much!

name: Vara Mayers
text: Wow! The first doctor who called me at home after my surgery and gave me his personal phone number so i can contact him when i have something that concerned me. I texted him later that week at 8:30 pm, he responded right away. He is very professional and the ladies who works there are very nice. He did an excellent job on my surgery.

name: Herbert Doshier
text: Dr. Lane was thorough in his examination and evaluation of my condition, explained my options, made recommendations and answered my all questions.  A very good experience.  I left with confidence in the decision I made to go ahead with the recommended procedure.

name: Charissa Hayes
text: This was my first time to go to an Endodontist and was so upset because  I had been informed by my Dentist that I was going to have some tooth loss due to bone loss. Very upsetting for most but especially for a woman. I was referred to Dr. Lane.  Dr. Lane and his entire staff were the most professional and kind people I have ever encountered under one roof. They did a thorough evaluation then consulted with me presenting a document of their findings and discussing options with me, details for the options both financially, aesthetically, and clinically. They did not rush through anything, but took the time to discuss, explain, and answer questions regarding my plan of treatment. Very highly recommended.

name: Diana Fischer
text: Dr Lane is very thorough and an extremely  personable doctor. I would highly recommend him.

name: Cayce Perry
text: Excellent doctor!   He made me feel very comfortable and at ease about my procedure.   He not only talked to me before the surgery making sure I was comfortable with the procedure or if I had any questions, he also talked to my husband before and after.  The surgery went great. Post surgery update: Dr. Lane corrected a receding gum for me with a gum graft. Dr. Lane asked me how much I wanted to know before giving me too much or not enough detail which was wonderful because I want to know it all and sometimes don't know what to ask. Going into the procedure I knew exactly what to expect and the only thing I expected that didn't happen was the pain. This procedure and recovery was surprisingly painless, I was sore but never enough to require pain medicine. Also, Dr. Lane was very clear that there was no guarantee for total root coverage, but 2 weeks out I have total root coverage and the results look wonderful. I still 100% recommend Dr. Lane!!

name: Pete Pappelis
text:
The dentist that I had been seeing for almost fourteen years unfortunately retired so I have been trying to find a replacement. I recently cracked a tooth, and I was referred to a local dentist, so I decided to give them a try. Folks, just because someone has a fancy office does not mean that they are a reputable business, at least in my experience. It is not typical of me bad mouthing a local business and I will keep their name out of this review, but they are an embarrassment to the noble profession of dentistry. When I was seen by the hygienist, she responded, "Oh wow that is bad, you will need to have that tooth extracted immediately". My initial thought was "I didn't realize that a hygienist was also a doctor of dentistry". Then when the dental assistant took the x-rays, her response was identical! What made matters worse the doctor backed up what they said and wanted to extract the tooth right there and then!!! I was concerned and confused so I asked what the cost would be. They brought in the "closer" with the three options. Just yank it, yank it and create a cap with a bridge like a denture or the option that I would probably have chosen, yank it and have an implant which would have cost over three thousand dollars, oh, by the way they have a company that will finance.
Thanks, but no thanks!
So, I walked out and I waited, maybe too long because I got a bad abscess. Now what do I do?
I researched and talked to many folks. I decided to give Southern dentistry a try and thank God I did. They got me in the next morning. Everyone that I came in contact with was very professional and friendly. From the receptionist to the dentist. The dental assistant took the x-ray and told me that the doctor will be with me shortly. Most of my experiences with doctors or dentists are that if you have an appointment be prepared to wait an hour or two before someone sees you. I was seen within a few minutes. Dr. Jessica Robinson was great, very professional and to the point and explained everything in detail. She recommended against extracting the tooth. She believed that the tooth can be saved. Her recommendation was to perform a root canal with a crown at a cost of less than a third of what the other dentist recommended! Very short and to the point treatment plan. NO FINANCING NEEDED!
How refreshing and what a great place. For once a dentist that understands CUSTOMER SERVICE! I highly recommend Southern dentistry. You will not be disappointed.
RAVING FAN

name: Alyssa Stellmaker
text:
This review is in response to a request sent to me after a dental procedure and included a side note that a review of less than 5-stars should be called into the office rather than placed online.  Dealing directly with the office was unresponsive. I’ve been a patient at Southern Dentistry, with Dr. Nebrig, for 3+ years, with numerous procedures performed. I don’t expect perfection; but, when a business won’t/can’t get you in to see the dentist for pain related to work that he performed and waiting too long could cause further or more serious damage, those little, previously forgiven imperfections compound.

Cons:  scheduling and communication.  Can’t get in to see a dentist; even as an established patient, for a dental emergency, or to get a newly placed crown adjusted. If there is a problem with dental work that was completed there-such as a crown that’s too high, pain/possible tooth infection/root canal needed after dental repair 3 weeks prior but persistent pain when chewing, the office will, literally, tell you that they are “too busy” to see you. You have to schedule a regular appt, which is many months out.  Neither pain, facial bruising, nor new pain at the contact tooth will matter. One of the assistants who places crowns will ignore a patient’s cry of pain in hopes of rapidly finishing the crown fitting on a raw tooth. When the crown felt a little high during it’s placement, the assistant didn’t dry the tooth before using the chalk paper and told me to wait until I wasn’t numb and to give the teeth time to adjust; they’d move around a bit and I could easily come back in to get it adjusted. The amalgam fillings have a rough/sandy texture that leaves the tooth constantly feeling dirty.   The wait time before work/cleaning begins is often 45-60 min.  If insurance covers at 50%, you overpay before the work is done at a 40% coverage. This policy is left to the patient to discover. When questioning the math for the estimates and lack of refunds or j completed work, they say they will reimburse the difference after all the insurance claims have paid.  After all of the work that’s been done, I’m aware of only one reimbursement.  Perhaps, the overpayments were applied to other procedures and they forgot to tell me. My insurance claims for one procedure showed that I had overpaid Southern Dentistry by something like $86 and the front office confirmed the same amount a couple months after the claim. When I was at my next procedure and asked to have that $86 reimbursement applied to the current procedure, the office said I had $8 owed to me and my “insurance must not have paid fully for an X-ray or something.”  (They didn’t apply the $8 toward the current procedure or give me the money back.) Providing patients with a break down receipt that shows the portions the patient and insurance paid, and the refund owed to the patient would enhance trust and clarity.  At one appt, the office was in such a hurry to get patients out the door that they skipped my annual X-rays and said they would do them at the next cleaning, in 6 months.

Pros:  Dr. Nebrig has a charismatic and laid back, jubilant personality. He does a great job numbing the area that will receive work and calming an anxious patient.  He takes pride in and enjoys his work, and completes the procedures quickly.  Same day crowns drastically improve an unpleasant and time consuming dental procedure.  The office location is convenient. Silver fillings aren’t used.  The hygienists, assistants, and dentist are friendly and gentle.  The sport-top water bottles provided  after a procedure exemplifies attention to detail and patient needs. The facility is clean. The office accepts a lot of different insurances. The business wants patient feedback.

text: Sent me to collection for $76.00. During a PANDEMIC! DONT GO THERE. Wouldn't even accept a payment from from me, she said I had to pay collection  3rd party

resp.text: I'm so sorry for the incovenience.  We make every effort to handle accounts within our dental family, however our universal policy is that after 3 months of sending statements with no response, our balances are handled by a different company.  Once it is in there hands, we can no longer handle the payments.  Our desire is to be a comforting, quality dental home for our community, and having to chase debts takes away from our focus on the people that we need to care for.   We have carefully selected a debt collection agency who has a history of pursuing accounts in an accurate honest way in order to make the process as simple for those involved as possible.

name: Phillip Cotton
text: Amazing job for all staff at this office. Started with a quick  phone call to setup our 1st appointment with a quick turnaround on availability. Once at the office check in was easy and before we had time to complete electronic check in they were ready. The staff went to work right away. Once done they completed my checkout, scheduled my next cleaning appointment, gave me a goody bag and a flower⚘. That is amazing customer service. Very pleased!!!

resp.text: Thank you Phillip! We really try :)

name: Mari J
text:
-->UPDATE<-- Today, 5/27/20, I went in to get 2 cavaties filled. I was a little upset that I had to call to reschedule my appointment, originally for 4/6, (due to COVID)... I guess I just thought that the patients in pain, would at least get a call FIRST to reschedule any important procedures - that didn't happen. Thankfully, I called in late April & was able to get an appt for today, 5/27. I get there at 10:20, my appointment time, let them know I'm there, only to be told, "You're appointment is scheduled for 11:10". This was due some type of system issue they were having (understandable, not their fault). BEFORE they take payment, she goes over what they are doing today + how much it would cost. I immediately asked if that price included the nitrous oxide gas (my cost $50). She said no and amended my new payment to include the gas. After waiting for way longer than usual, I was called in and told, "I'm sorry, the truck hasn't delivered the oxygen".
Yes, I had about 2-3 panick/anxiety attacks in the chair but after 2 hours of crying, it isfis .... for now.
Now, I'm in lots of pain and I can't even begin to describe it ... I can't open my mouth + chewing is OUT of the Question!!!!
I really hope Dr. Nebrig and his staff makes this right bc I thought I FINALLY found a dentist that I can trust + does good work at good prices.
***********************************************
(August 2019) Dr. Nebrig and his staff are MARVELOUS. The environment is very relaxing. I was called back as soon as I arrived (literally no wait time in the lobby - not used to such a quick call back once I check in at other facilities I've visited in the past 🙃). I was greeted with smiling faces and just felt "Welcomed". The girls were the most amazing assistants with my VERY FIRST root canal! They went over + above to ensure I was in as little discomfort as possible. Sidney even brought me a blanket while I waited on my crown to be delivered. Dr. Nebrig has an amazing bedside manner and is very kind and considerate. The staff called me the next morning to check and see how I was doing. I would recommend Southern Dentistry to ANYONE - matter of fact, I've been raving about them since my visit! Keep up the great work!!!

resp.text: Thank you Mari, We really try!

text: Went in for a cleaning, the staff was very professional and attentive to my needs!! Dr. Robinson came in, made her recommendations and was available for questions. name: Alison Harper
text: Called today as a new patient without insurance, bad tooth ache, Friday after lunch and leaving for a 7 day cruise on Sunday. After calling around I was losing hope of getting seen. However, when I called southern dentistry Taylor said she may have a cancellation late in the day and took my name and number. Not expecting a return call, I kept calling around with no luck. At 3:41 Taylor called me and said they could get me in today! I was super impressed that she was that concerned about me especially late on a Friday. They quickly got me back and I was seen by Dr. Robinson. They diagnosed my problem and we agreed on a treatment plan within 15 minutes. Dr Robinson was so pleasant and made it clear that she was confident and knowledgeable. I have my follow up appointment for after my vacay but am so thankful to know I won’t need emergency dental work in the middle of the Caribbean!

name: Leslie Bell
text: I’ve always loved Southern Dentistry! I have been a patient of Dr. Nebrig’s for at least 4-5 years. I always tell people about them, also. It just seems over the last year or so they have got extremely busier & their appointments book up fast and you might have to wait to get an appointment if you’re not in pain. Not to mention today, I had an appointment at the Daphne office & I had to call back to make the follow up appointment. I literally was left on hold for 13 minutes. When she picked the phone up, she answered like who originally answered had forgot I was sitting on hold.

text: I've been going here the past couple of years and had nothing but excellent experiences whether it was for fillings or cleanings.  It's always been painless. As usual, Dr. Robinson and the hygienist did an excellent job, but the operational side is just as impressive.  I literally checked in and sat in the lobby for 2 minutes before I was called back (they've always been on time).  Thirty minutes later I was leaving.  They are great.

name: Tara Hyde
text:
Had a dental emergency on a Thursday just after 5pm. No one returned my calls and my son had seriously broken about 5 teeth with nerves exposed, which required about $900 worth of fixing after ins paid.
I was at the mercy of trying to get another dentist who wasn’t ours to come in after hrs to fix him up.
To top matters off, they didn’t return my multiple calls until the following Tuesday. They may do good dental work, but they weren’t there for us when we needed care the most! Chose wisely!

resp.text: I am so sorry that you had such a hard time getting in touch with us.  Our Robertsdale office is open on Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday.  We have the Daphne location open 5 days a week and my cell phone number is on the voicemail there, so I am accessible on weekends too.  I will make sure this information is on the voicemail so that it doesn't happen again.  Thank you for letting me know, and again, I'm sorry that you couldn't get in touch with us.  Dr. Michael Nebrig, DMD

name: Sharon McMahon
text:
I had a large cavity in my back tooth where my nerve was exposed.  I had put off making an appointment until I couldn't wait any longer.  I was referred to Dr. Nebrig by my parents' dentist in Birmingham, and I didn't hesitate to make an appointment after reading so many great reviews.
I called the office on a Friday to see how soon they would be able to see me.  They found a cancellation on the following Monday and fit me in.  After a thorough examination, it was determined that I needed a root canal, and they were able to do it the following day!  Not only were they able to do the root canal, but they also made and fit my crown within an hour after the root canal was completed!
With all of that said, the staff was absolutely amazing throughout the entire process.  They were so genuinely caring and helpful, taking time to get to know me personally and put me at ease... and I can't say enough about Dr. Nebrig.  He is kind, competant,  caring, and funny... I feel completely safe in his care, and I know my family and I have found a home at Southern Dentistry!

text: Dr. Nebrig and his staff are wonderful. I had a filling done yesterday, and they just called to check on me and make sure I was doing well. The office itself is clean and bright. They have massage chairs, and you get to pick your music (bonus is Dr. Nebrig will sing for you too :)) Going to the dentist is no longer an anxiety inducing, dreaded appointment. Highly recommend them!

text: Very personable. Took time to explain everything. Nice, clean office. I will recommend them to my family and friends!

name: Jody Hirst
text:
Today was the first day in my 16 year old daughters life that she went to the dentist by herself.
When I asked her how it went, she said “horrible”.
She said she waited for 30 minutes to be taken back.  And when she finally got in the chair, she had to listen to your employees argue about who would clean her teeth.  Neither one felt like working today I suppose.
As I’ve never had a bad experience in your office, I’m appalled at how badly you screwed this up.  This is how you lose an entire family as patients.

R/
Jody Hirst

resp.text: Hi Jody.  I'm so sorry to hear about her bad experience.  As you have experienced in the past, that is very unusual.  I was in our other office when this occurred and as soon as I read your note I inquired about the event.  It seems that it was miscommunication between the hygienists and your daughter.  Rhonda was scheduled to see her, but was spending a lot of time reviewing a complicated treatment plan with her patient.  Faye had a cancelation at that time, and volunteered to see your daughter instead (to try to avoid any longer delays).  The "argument" was regarding whether Rhonda needed Faye to help her out or if Rhonda could see her just a little later.  The effort was to get to your daughter as soon as possible, not trying to avoid her.  I'm sorry that it did not come across that way.  Thank you for bringing this to my attention.  All feedback helps us to become a better office.  Dr. Michael Nebrig, DMD

text:
Dr. was extremely rough and I was sore for days after. Permanently damaged my gum and is till painful and it is visibly noticeable years later. I have to get corrected what they "fixed". Worst dental experience I have ever encountered.

I finally had the time and worked up the courage to find a highly recommended cosmetic dentist to have bonding corrected. To my horror my tooth was tampered with and filed down and had cracks from being sanded at this office. I also have had to make an appointment with a periodontist to try to avoid any further gum rescission and to prevent tooth loss. This is my experience and I wish it were further from the truth but it’s what happened to me when I chose this office to do simple bonding work. I will not be back to have anything “corrected”.

text: Dr. Johnson did a WONDERFUL job. I had 4 wisdom teeth removed, and after I wore off the medicine you would never guess I just had 4 teeth cut out! Even in the back where he cut them out you can't tell. The staff was also AMAZING and VERY nice! Nothing less than 5 stars!

text: Set consultation 3 months out then quote 2300 to remove 3 wisdom tooth..... highly upset

text: Our experience was great. I took my 15 yr old granddaughter to have her 4 wisdom teeth pulled all at one time. I was a little nervous about this but she wasn't. And with good reason. The staff and Dr Johnson was great. They explained everything very well. We went on a Tues for the exam and on Friday her teeth was out. It took about 15 min. She had iv for pain and only had a slight ache afterwards which we were given pain meds just in case. She only used about 3 or 4. Our experience was a good one and I would recommend them to anyone looking to have oral surgery.

text: What a bunch of jerks!  I can’t get an appointment because I’m not in their system anymore-even though I have seen Dr Johnson before!  So they want me to find a dentist to refer me again.  Really?  After explaining I had been getting my teeth removed in Ga at an oral surgeon in Columbus.  IDIOTS!  I hate IDIOT schedulers!  I went to school a lot more longer than that little girl did to be treated rudely.

text:
They start by following the CoVid protocols which I like.  The hygienist was very competent and friendly at the same time giving me feedback on where I need to pay attention in my mouth.  The doctor was also very knowledgeable
and friendly as well.  I had another great experience.

name: Heike Childs
text: High quality periodontics care and welcoming personnel in a.beautiful setting made me feel comfortable and at ease for having work done by North Alabama Periodontics and Implant Surgery. After having made the appointment, due to Covid 19 rules, I called after I parked my car, to let them know I'm there. I was invited in just as soon as I got there and in no time at all everything was attended to. The people are technically highly skilled at their work but they are also very likable. I appreciate everyone trying so very hard to prevent their customers from feeling nervous about any procedure and were frequently checking during the procedures if I was comfortable. The process was pain free due to a quick and easy numbing of the affected area. They are paid by their customer directly but offer to file insurance forms on behalf of their customers  to be reimbursed, provided one is insured. I recommend these folks.

name: Arthur Tokaz
text: Always courteous and timely. Explains all procedures and results in detail. Very satisfied with results.

text: I had a wonderful experience at North Alabama Periodontics! The staff are very friendly, professional and diligent to give you the very best of care.
